title: Spring Rolls

ingredients.content: 1500 g water, plus warm water for softening
50 g iceberg lettuce leaves, chopped in small pieces

preparations.content: Place carrots and peanuts in mixing bowl then chop <b>7 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place sunflower oil and chives in mixing bowl then heat <b>1 min/100°C/speed 1<b>. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside to steep.
Place water in mixing bowl and bring to the boil <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>.
Add vermicelli noodles then cook <b>5 min//speed 2<b>. Drain through simmering basket then run under cold running water to stop cooking. Add to bowl with oil and chives then mix with spatula.
Add beansprouts and half reserved carrot-peanut mixture to noodles then mix with spatula.
Dip rice wrapper (Ø 16 cm) in warm water for 3-4 seconds then transfer to a chopping board.

In centre of rice wrapper, lay ⅛ of chopped iceburg lettuce, ⅛ noodle mixture and sprinkle with chopped herbs. Roll bottom of wrapper over filling and fold in sides. Lay 3-4 prawns on rice wrapper just before finishing rolling, so that it is visible through the spring roll. Repeat with remaining 7 wrappers.
Add fish sauce to remaining half of carrot-peanut mixture. Serve dipping sauce with the spring rolls.

hintsAndTricks: If tinned bean sprouts cannot be found, use fresh but ensure they are cooked and drained according to instructions before using.

If rice paper is difficult to get hold of, use 3 sheets of filo pastry. Repeat layers as described in method down one long side of pastry (about 2 cm from pastry edge) roll, folding in sides and seal with water. Cut into pieces as desired. Brush lightly with oil before baking. Bake for 15-20 minutes (200°C).
Omit prawns for a vegetarian alternative, and replace with peanut halves, if desired, when folding so nuts are visible through rice paper.
